page.title: 05Kippax Church (cont)....
page.content: In the windows there is no old glass remaining but in 1620 there was a consideable amount of old stained glass bearing local family names of the delaceys , Castille Fitzallen Warren , Leventhorpe , Clair , Savile , Thornhill Goldsborough Eure and Scrope families , The roof is almost flat and the timbers rest on stone corbels. Near the window in the South East of the sanctuary there are two piscina niches dating back to the 13 th century. The font is cup-shaped and is a Restoration Font built in 1663 , In the Parish Register dating from 1539 coal mining was mentioned 1659. There is also record of a free school being founded in 1549 by reverand George Goldsworth. The church was dedicated to Saint Mary.To the south of the porch is a sundial mounted on a badly weathered pillar.
